text: so static compilation either needs to have libjulia bound to it, or it needs to have no dynamic dispatching in order to ensure that it only hits the available methods.

elements.text: so static compilation either needs to have libjulia bound to it, or it needs to have no dynamic dispatching in order to ensure that it only hits the available methods.

text: Once we split out the runtime from libjulia, you can still link to libjulia for runtime things like dynamic dispatch and tasks and such

elements.text: Once we split out the runtime from libjulia, you can still link to libjulia for runtime things like dynamic dispatch and tasks and such

text: No one really wants truly static programs these days, anyway

elements.text: No one really wants truly static programs these days, anyway

text: <@U6A0PD8CR> I want truly static program preferably in LLVM IR so i can at some point in future turn high level Julia code into self contained binaries for embedded architectures.
